The BBB will once again offer free shredding as part of our nationwide Secure Your ID Day on April 26 from 9 a.m. to 12 noon at two locations in Charlotte.
Shred-It Parking Lot - 3421 Axar Road, Charlotte, N.C.
Jay M. Robinson Middle School - 5925 Ballantyne Commons Parkway, Charlotte, N.C.
Limit four large bags or boxes per car. Shredding is the easiest way to prevent identity theft.
Special thanks to our partners: Shred-It, CMPD and the Mecklenburg County Consumer Fraud Taskforce.

Description:
The Steele Creek Residents Association is hosting its annual meeting on February 25, 2016. Please join the CMPD and various city, county, and state leaders that will be on hand to answer any questions or concerns that you may have. The meeting is very informative and I have always enjoyed finding out about future happenings in our area. See below for more ... View more details. Thank you,
 
The Steele Creek Residents Association Annual Meeting will be on Thursday, February 25 at Christ the King Church. We are inviting the community to attend a meet and greet with local government and non-profit organizations beginning at 6:30. We will have tables available for each organization. There will be presentations on roads (Highway 160) and elections beginning at 7:00, followed by an additional meet and greet period beginning at 7:30. We are inviting candidates running for offices in districts that extend into Steele Creek to participate in the Meet and Mingle.
Officer Hill/Frazer - 704 336 8549
 
rhill@cmpd.org
mfrazer@cmpd.org

Description:
The Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Department is scheduled for an on-site assessment as part of a program to achieve re-accreditation by verifying it meets professional standards.
Administered by the Commission on Accreditation for Law Enforcement Agencies, Inc. (CALEA), the accreditation program requires agencies to comply with state-of-the-art standards in four basic areas: policy and procedures, administration, operations, and support services.
Agency employees and the public are invited to offer comments by calling 704-336-8980 or 704-336-8993 on Monday, November 14, 2016 from 3:00PM to 5:00PM. Comments will be taken by the Assessment team.
Also, as part of the on-site assessment, agency employees and members of the community are invited to offer comments at a public information session on Monday, November 14, 2016 at 7:00PM at Johnson C. Smith University 100 Beatties Ford Rd Charlotte, NC 28216.
For further information or questions, please contact Sergeant J.F. Gallant at 704-353-1139.
Anyone wishing to submit written comments about the Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Departmentâs ability to comply with the standards for accreditation may send them to the Commission on Accreditation for Law Enforcement Inc. (CALEA) 13575 Heathcote Blvd, Suite 320 Gainesville, Virginia, 20155.
Location: Johnson C Smith University, 100 Beatties Ford Road
Title: Public Information Session re: CMPD Accreditation with CALEA

Description: The Criminal Investigations Bureau is having a Community Forum on Tuesday, March 21 at 6 pm at the Mecklenburg County Bar Association located at 2850 Zebulon Avenue.  There will be detectives on hand from Homicide, Missing Persons, Robbery, Sexual Assault Unit, Crimes Against Children, Financial Crimes, Cyber Crimes, and Domestic Violence to briefly speak to what each unit handles and then answer any questions.  We will have detectives available for specific questions, handouts on prevention and resources available.

Description: The Galilee Center, Refugee Support Service to engage refugees with positive interaction, answer questions pertaining to laws, and provide CMPD resources. This is the second annual CIT recognition event. Some of our CIT officers will be receiving awards (award categories listed below)â¦  We would very much appreciate your attendance and lunch will be provided. If you plan on attending, please register using the following link. Please let me know if you have any questions.

	Registration is required. Register at:
http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2947587

Christian

CIT Officer of the Year- An officer that has actively been engaged in the program, participates, and is always present
CIT Advocate of the Year- Someone who speaks out about CIT 
CIT Partner of the Year- Community member or agency that has been partnering with CIT and advocates the program 
CIT Intervention of the Year- A specific event where a CIT officer utilized there training 
CIT Leadership Award of the Year- A Leadership Personnel within the police department that advocates for the program
Title: Mecklenburg County CIT Community Awareness & Recognition Event
